alert.note: Alert for Eastern Norfolk; Eastern Plymouth; Southeast Middlesex; Suffolk; Western Norfolk; Western Plymouth (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 6:23PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Norfolk, Suffolk, east central Middlesex and north central Plymouth Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 623 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Dedham, or near Needham, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy downpours. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Little to no impact from hail is expected. Locations impacted include... Boston, Cambridge, Quincy, Newton, Somerville, Waltham, Brookline, Weymouth, Braintree, Randolph, Watertown, Needham, Norwood, Wellesley, Milton, Dedham, Hingham, Canton, Scituate and Winthrop. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for eastern, southeastern and northeastern Massachusetts.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Norfolk; Eastern Plymouth; Southeast Middlesex; Suffolk; Western Norfolk; Western Plymouth
